trial_identification.studytitle: Peripherally Inserted Central Catheters Prospective Study of Complications and Parental/Child Satisfaction
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Peripherally Inserted Central Catheters Prospective Study of Complications and Parental/Child Satisfaction

conditions.healthcondition: Complications of peripeherally inserted central venous catheters and patient satisfaction

interventions.interventions: Insertion of a peripherally inserted central venous catheter (PICC), study duration 12 months. Duration of procedure 15-120 min.

primaryOutcome.outcome: The frequency of early removal of peripherally inserted central vernous catheters, which is prior to intended treatment finishing, due to complications with the PICC or accidental removal Outcome assessment by clinical monitoring and follow-up phone calls.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Time of insertion and then weekly until removal of device

secondaryOutcome.outcome: The frequency of catheter-related bloodstream infections are defined as bacteraemia/fungaemia in a patient with an intravascular catheter with at least one positive blood culture obtained from a peripheral vein, and/or clinical manifestations of infection (i.e. fever, chills, and/or hypotension), and no apparent course for the bloodstream infection except the catheter. Where this cannot clearly be determined the information will be reviewed by an independent reviewer. Assessed by clinical examination and follow-up phone calls.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Time of insertion and then weekly until removal of device

secondaryOutcome.outcome: The frequency of phlebitis, thrombosis, PICC occlusion Assessed by clinical examination and follow-up phone calls.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Time of insertion and then weekly until removal of device

secondaryOutcome.outcome: mechanical complications (leaking, broken device), accidental dislodgement, haemorrhage, migration, procedure related trauma (pneumothorax, haemothorax and accidental arterial puncture) and death. Assessed by clinical examination and follow-up phone calls.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Time of insertion and then weekly until removal of device

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Child/parental satisfaction with the device.Assessed by clinical examination and follow-up phone calls.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Time of insertion and then weekly until removal of device

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: insertion of peripherally inserted central venous catheters (PICC) in theatre or paediatric intensive care unit (PICU)

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: Department of Anaesthesia Roberts Road SUBIACO, WA 6008

fundingsource.fundingaddress: Department of Anaesthesia Roberts Road SUBIACO, WA 6008

secondarysponsor.sponsoraddress: Department of Anaesthesia Roberts Road SUBIACO, WA 6008

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The objectives of this trial were to observe the following in order to investigate ways to improve care: To determine current complication rates for PICC & CVL lines inserted by anaesthetic department at PMH To determine rationale behind insertion. Identifying impact of previous line history on potential failure rates Identifying parent and patient satisfaction with lines since standardisation of strapping and care of lines.
